results.title: Solar dawn (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts, Gareth Cole and Solarscope Films
results.brief_description: Utilises many animation sequences to clearly show how basic solar collectors work. It shows how buildings can be heated and cooled by solar devices, and how city buildings and ordinary houses should be designed to take advantage of direct solar energy.

results.title: The Living rain forest
results.creator_credit: Richard Brock, British Broadcasting Corporation and British Petroleum
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Web of life”.
Stresses the balance of nature within this ecosystem. Each level of the rain forest ecosystem is carefully examined to show the food chains present. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Man and his world: a Norwegian fjord
results.brief_description: This film concerns the gradual reconciliation of the traditional way of life with modern technology and industrial development as it has occurred in the small town of Tyssedal on the Hardangar Fjord in Norway. Once devoted solely to dairy farming, fruit growing and fishing, many of the town’s inhabitants are now employed in the huge aluminium smelting plant located at a short distance from the town. A young Tyssedal school boy and his family are among those affected by this transition in the way of life.

results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle

results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.

results.title: Dogs
results.creator_credit: Diane Belle James, Michael Murphy and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: A group of dogs in the countryside and at home. The camera observes in a sensitive and detailed way: as the dogs explore a stream and drink, we see how their tongues work to toss beads of water upwards; the rhythms and sounds, the ways of relating and communicating that are special to dogs. Includes a brief birth sequence.

results.title: Tops
results.brief_description: Tops are among man’s oldest and most popular toys. This non-narrated film features 123 spinning tops from different lands. The essence of tops is captured as the stages of their movement are displayed. The second in the unfinished trilogy of toy films (ships would have been next). Music by Elmer Bernstein.
